fields.content:
Popular talented singer-songwriter returns to Printers with great original music and top covers in his own style! Ben will be supported by his friend, fellow singer-songwriter Scott Doane.

www,facebook.com/benwestwoodmusic
www.benwestwoodmusic.com
Tickets £5

All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ 

Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
fields.excerpt: Singer-songwriter Ben Westwood performs as a duo with multi-instrumentalist Scott Doane, playing a range of acoustic originals and covers that blend folk, blues, rock and soul.
fields.title: Ben Westwood

fields.content:
Marky started teaching himself piano at the age of 14. After moving to London, Marky was soon a regular on the circuit working as resident pianist in pubs and bars, entertaining audiences with his wide repertoire of covers and catchy originals.

Playing in his unique style of energetic piano based Rock 'n' Roll, Marky doesn't use backing tracks: it's all live and he's happy to take requests. After all, with a song list covering 7 decades there's a pretty good chance he'll know the song you love!
Tickets £5

All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ 

Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
fields.excerpt: Marky started teaching himself piano at the age of 14. After moving to London, Marky was soon a regular on the circuit working as resident pianist in pubs and bars, entertaining audiences with his wide repertoire of covers and catchy originals.
fields.title: Marky Dawson

fields.content:
Join Helen Ward - Jackson and Natalie Roberts for a night at the musicals.

Featuring songs from all your favourite West End and Broadway leading ladies.

All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ 

Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
fields.excerpt: Join Helen Ward - Jackson and Natalie Roberts for a night at the musicals.
fields.title: Leading Ladies

fields.content:
The best open mic in Eastbourne. 

Free entry and first act from 8pm.

All musicians welcome! All poets welcome! All storytellers welcome! All comedians welcome!

Ticket MUST be booked in advance. £10 holding deposits for tables.

All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ 

Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
fields.excerpt: Musicians, poets, storytellers, comedians are all welcome! Basically anyone who needs a mic to express their art.
fields.title: Open Stage

fields.content:
In these tough times, Life’s a struggle. There’s unfulfilled expectations. Humdrum existences needing an injection of life. Millions wishing something, would happen to them, to fill the void in their lives. Clearly everyone “else” is happy. Online celebrations and holiday pics prove it. Jane can’t take it anymore. She needs that something, anything! but how far is she willing to go to get it?

If you purchased a ticket or tickets for the original run of Happenings at the Grove in December 2020, but were unable to attend on account of being resident in a then-Tier 3 or 4 area, you may exchange your ticket(s) for either of these two performances. Please contact us at grovetheatreeastbourne@gmail.com for your exchange to be processed. This does not apply to those who received refunds on their tickets.
fields.excerpt:
Printers at the Grove
A new play by John Berry
fields.title: Happenings

fields.content:
We are thrilled that on our opening weekend we will be presenting a brand new two hander Treble Twenty, a fantastic new PPH production and our first piece of theatre this year. We are also delighted that Script Works Productions are filming it, so that as well as being a COVID secure bubbled live production, it will also be available online!

Roy is an old fashioned, red faced bigot of a man with opinions that could make Alf Garnett look prudish. His teammate is Jim, a man who has been biting his tongue for so long that he is in danger of severing it. The only thing these two men have in common is their weekly darts game, as they prepare for the forthcoming Foyle’s Cup tensions begin to mount. Could this be their last game or will someone 180?

Written by: Scott Kingsnorth
Matthew Devitt - Roy
Karl Williamson - Jim
Directed by: John Berry
Gino Isaacs - Filming

Limited tickets available for this Covid secure event so book now. 

Tickets £14 each Concession available 

Should this event need to be postponed tickets will be transferable.

All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ 

Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
fields.excerpt:
Printers at the Grove
A new play by Scott Kingsnorth
fields.title: Treble Twenty

fields.content:
Join big Al Arcane and the Nightrider for a COVID Safe performance!

Big Al's musical project is to blend traditional Rhythm 'n Blues with modern styling to create an inclusion that celebrates cultural variety. He enjoys roots music; blues, boogie and the jazz developed from these influences.

Tickets £5

All events are in pre-booked ‘bubbles’ 

Book your bubbles by emailing us at: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
